FuncDef:
The emdi alarm threshold command configures the alarm thresholds of the packet loss rate and packet disorder rate in EMDI detection.
The undo emdi alarm threshold command restores the default configuration.
By default, the alarm thresholds corresponding to various EMDI monitoring periods are shown in Guide:
CLIs: emdi alarm { rtp-lr | rtp-ser } { sd | hd | 4k } threshold <threshold-value>
undo emdi alarm { rtp-lr | rtp-ser } { sd | hd | 4k } threshold [ <threshold-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the packet loss rate of RTP packets.
-

Indicates the packet disorder rate of RTP packets.
-

Specifies an alarm threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 5000, in 1/100000.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a device deployed with the EMDI detection solution detects that the packet disorder rate and packet loss rate of various video streams exceed the specified thresholds, the device reports an alarm to the NMS. To configure the alarm thresholds of the packet loss rate and packet disorder rate for various video sources (SD, HD, and 4K), run the emdi alarm threshold command.
By default, the alarm thresholds corresponding to various EMDI monitoring periods are as follows:

Configuration Impact
When a detection indicator equals to the configured alarm threshold, an alarm is generated.
Precautions
When the monitoring period has been changed using the emdi monitor-period command, the alarm thresholds are automatically changed to the default values corresponding to the new monitoring period.
